creditline: Gift of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: accordian volume with grey cover and silver detail; inside contains colorful woodblock prints
markings: inscriptions inside front cover and in third-fourth leaf; inscription last page; seal front cover, near title, LRC, rectangular relief seal; seal back page, round relief stamp LLC
signed: title on label center of front cover; date last page
text: This work is comprised of three woodblock printed albums, each containing 20 double-page compositions, including popular Rinpa motifs such as deer among pine trees, waves, and the Eight Folded Bridge. Though the albums are intended as printed art rather than a book of patterns, a number of the designs reappear on three-dimensional works such as trays and lacquer boxes, as well as in Sekka’s later paintings. While deeply rooted in the traditions of Japanese art, Sekka was a visionary transitional figure between those forms and modern design and production. (2013.3.26.1-.3)
title: Things from Many Worlds, volume one of three
